com.stripe.android.model

Class SourceParams

  • com.stripe.android.model.SourceParams
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StripeParamsModel

    public class SourceParams
implements StripeParamsModel

    Represents a grouping of parameters needed to create a class Source object on the server.

    See Also:
    class Source

    • Field Detail

      • Companion

        public static com.stripe.android.model.SourceParams.Companion Companion

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        @NotNull
public java.lang.String getType()

        The type of the source to create.

      • getAmount

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Long getAmount()

        Amount associated with the source. This is the amount for which the source will be chargeable once ready. Required for single_use sources. Not supported for receiver type sources, where charge amount may not be specified until funds land.

        See amount

        See Also:
        amount

      • getApiParameterMap

        @Nullable
public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getApiParameterMap()

        A Map of the parameters specific to the Source type.

        See Also:

public java.lang.String getCurrency()

        See currency

        See Also:
        currency

      • getReturnUrl

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String getReturnUrl()

        The URL you provide to redirect the customer back to you after they authenticated their payment. It can use your application URI scheme in the context of a mobile application.

public com.stripe.android.model.SourceParams.OwnerParams getOwner()

      • getUsage

        @Nullable
public com.stripe.android.model.Source.Usage getUsage()

        Either reusable or single_use. Whether this source should be reusable or not. Some source types may or may not be reusable by construction, while others may leave the option at creation. If an incompatible value is passed, an error will be returned.

        See usage

        See Also:
        usage

      • createP24Params

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public static SourceParams createP24Params(long amount,
                                                                @NotNull
                                                                java.lang.String currency,
                                                                @Nullable
                                                                java.lang.String name,
                                                                @NotNull
                                                                java.lang.String email,
                                                                @NotNull
                                                                java.lang.String returnUrl)

        Create P24 Source params.

        Parameters:
        amount - A positive integer in the smallest currency unit representing the amount tocharge the customer (e.g., 1099 for a €10.99 payment).
        currency - eur or pln (P24 payments must be in either Eurosor Polish Zloty).
        name - The name of the account holder (optional).
        email - The email address of the account holder.
        returnUrl - The URL the customer should be redirected to after the authorizationprocess.
        Returns:
        a class SourceParams that can be used to create a P24 source

      • createAlipayReusableParams

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public static SourceParams createAlipayReusableParams(@NotNull
                                                                           java.lang.String currency,
                                                                           @Nullable
                                                                           java.lang.String name,
                                                                           @Nullable
                                                                           java.lang.String email,
                                                                           @NotNull
                                                                           java.lang.String returnUrl)

        Create reusable Alipay Source params.

        Parameters:
        currency - The currency of the payment. Must be the default currency for your country.Can be aud, cad, eur, gbp, hkd, jpy, nzd, sgd, or usd. Users in Denmark,Norway, Sweden, or Switzerland must use eur.
        name - The name of the account holder (optional).
        email - The email address of the account holder (optional).
        returnUrl - The URL the customer should be redirected to after the authorizationprocess.
        Returns:
        a class SourceParams that can be used to create an Alipay reusable source

      • createAlipaySingleUseParams

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public static SourceParams createAlipaySingleUseParams(long amount,
                                                                            @NotNull
                                                                            java.lang.String currency,
                                                                            @Nullable
                                                                            java.lang.String name,
                                                                            @Nullable
                                                                            java.lang.String email,
                                                                            @NotNull
                                                                            java.lang.String returnUrl)

        Create single-use Alipay Source params.

        Parameters:
        amount - A positive integer in the smallest currency unit representing the amount tocharge the customer (e.g., 1099 for a $10.99 payment).
        currency - The currency of the payment. Must be the default currency for your country.Can be aud, cad, eur, gbp, hkd, jpy, nzd, sgd, or usd. Users in Denmark,Norway, Sweden, or Switzerland must use eur.
        name - The name of the account holder (optional).
        email - The email address of the account holder (optional).
        returnUrl - The URL the customer should be redirected to after the authorizationprocess.
        Returns:
        a class SourceParams that can be used to create an Alipay single-use source

      • createWeChatPayParams

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public static SourceParams createWeChatPayParams(long amount,
                                                                      @NotNull
                                                                      java.lang.String currency,
                                                                      @NotNull
                                                                      java.lang.String weChatAppId,
                                                                      @Nullable
                                                                      java.lang.String statementDescriptor)

        Create WeChat Pay Source params.

        Parameters:
        amount - A positive integer in thesmallest currency unitrepresenting the amount to charge the customer (e.g., 1099 for a $10.99 payment).
        currency - The currency of the payment. Must be the default currency for yourcountry. Can be aud, cad, eur, gbp, hkd, jpy, sgd, or usd.
        weChatAppId - Your registered WeChat Pay App ID fromWeChat Open Platform.
        statementDescriptor - (optional) A custom statement descriptor for the payment,maximum 32 characters. By default, your Stripe account’s statement descriptor isused (you can review this in the Dashboard.

      • createKlarna

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public static SourceParams createKlarna(@NotNull
                                                             java.lang.String returnUrl,
                                                             @NotNull
                                                             java.lang.String currency,
                                                             @NotNull
                                                             KlarnaSourceParams klarnaParams)

        Create params for a Klarna Source

        Klarna Payments with Sources

        Parameters:
        returnUrl - The URL you provide to redirect the customer back to you after theyauthenticated their payment. It can use your application URI scheme in the context ofa mobile application.
        currency - Three-letter ISO code for the currency associated with the source.This is the currency for which the source will be chargeable once ready.
        klarnaParams - Klarna-specific params
        See Also:
        Klarna Payments with Sources

      • createBancontactParams

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public static SourceParams createBancontactParams(long amount,
                                                                       @NotNull
                                                                       java.lang.String name,
                                                                       @NotNull
                                                                       java.lang.String returnUrl,
                                                                       @Nullable
                                                                       java.lang.String statementDescriptor,
                                                                       @Nullable
                                                                       java.lang.String preferredLanguage)

        Create Bancontact Source params.

        Parameters:
        amount - A positive integer in the smallest currency unit representing the amount tocharge the customer (e.g., 1099 for a €10.99 payment). The charge amount must beat least €1 or its equivalent in the given currency.
        name - The full name of the account holder.
        returnUrl - The URL the customer should be redirected to after the authorizationprocess.
        statementDescriptor - A custom statement descriptor for the payment (optional).
        preferredLanguage - The preferred language of the Bancontact authorization page that thecustomer is redirected to. Supported values are: en, de, fr, or nl(optional).
        Returns:
        a class SourceParams object that can be used to create a Bancontact source

      • createCustomParams

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public static SourceParams createCustomParams(@NotNull
                                                                   java.lang.String type)

        Create a custom class SourceParams object. Incorrect attributes may result in errors when connecting to Stripe's API.

        Parameters:
        type - a custom type
        Returns:
        an empty class SourceParams object.
        See Also:
        class SourceParams

        Parameters:

      • createSepaDebitParams

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public static SourceParams createSepaDebitParams(@NotNull
                                                                      java.lang.String name,
                                                                      @NotNull
                                                                      java.lang.String iban,
                                                                      @Nullable
                                                                      java.lang.String addressLine1,
                                                                      @NotNull
                                                                      java.lang.String city,
                                                                      @NotNull
                                                                      java.lang.String postalCode,
                                                                      @NotNull
                                                                      java.lang.String country)

        Create SEPA Debit Source params.

        Parameters:
        name - The full name of the account holder.
        iban - The IBAN number for the bank account that you wish to debit.
        addressLine1 - The first line of the owner's address (optional).
        city - The city of the owner's address.
        postalCode - The postal code of the owner's address.
        country - The ISO-3166 2-letter country code of the owner's address.
        Returns:
        a class SourceParams object that can be used to create a SEPA debit source

      • createSepaDebitParams

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public static SourceParams createSepaDebitParams(@NotNull
                                                                      java.lang.String name,
                                                                      @NotNull

                                                                      @Nullable

                                                                      @Nullable
                                                                      java.lang.String country)

        Create SEPA Debit Source params.

        Parameters:
        name - The full name of the account holder.
        iban - The IBAN number for the bank account that you wish to debit.
        email - The full email address of the owner (optional).
        addressLine1 - The first line of the owner's address (optional).
        city - The city of the owner's address.
        postalCode - The postal code of the owner's address.
        country - The ISO-3166 2-letter country code of the owner's address.
        Returns:
        a class SourceParams object that can be used to create a SEPA debit source

      • createSofortParams

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public static SourceParams createSofortParams(long amount,
                                                                   @NotNull

                                                                   @NotNull
                                                                   java.lang.String country,
                                                                   @Nullable
                                                                   java.lang.String statementDescriptor)

        Create SOFORT Source params.

        Parameters:
        amount - A positive integer in the smallest currency unit representing the amount tocharge the customer (e.g., 1099 for a €10.99 payment).
        returnUrl - The URL the customer should be redirected to after the authorizationprocess.

      • createThreeDSecureParams

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public static SourceParams createThreeDSecureParams(long amount,
                                                                         @NotNull
                                                                         java.lang.String currency,
                                                                         @NotNull
                                                                         java.lang.String returnUrl,
                                                                         @NotNull
                                                                         java.lang.String cardId)

        Create 3D Secure Source params.

        Parameters:
        amount - A positive integer in the smallest currency unit representing the amount tocharge the customer (e.g., 1099 for a €10.99 payment).
        currency - The currency the payment is being created in (e.g., eur).
        returnUrl - The URL the customer should be redirected to after the verification process.
        cardId - The ID of the card source.
        Returns:
        a class SourceParams object that can be used to create a 3D Secure source

                                                                         java.lang.String callId)

        Parameters:

      • createMasterpassParams

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public static SourceParams createMasterpassParams(@NotNull
                                                                       java.lang.String transactionId,
                                                                       @NotNull
                                                                       java.lang.String cartId)

        Create parameters needed to make a Masterpass source

        Parameters:
        transactionId - The transaction ID from the Masterpass SDK.
        cartId - A unique string that you generate to identify the purchase when creating a cartfor checkout in the Masterpass SDK.
        Returns:
        a class SourceParams object that can be used to create a Masterpass Card Source.

      • createRetrieveSourceParams

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> createRetrieveSourceParams(@NotNull
                                                                                                               java.lang.String clientSecret)

        Create parameters needed to retrieve a source.

        Parameters:
        clientSecret - the client secret for the source, needed because the Android SDK usesa public key
        Returns:
        a Map matching the parameter name to the client secret, ready to send to the server.
